first_translate: wow...
it’s so crowded here.
I feel like I’m people-watching instead of looking at flowers.
isn’t this beautiful?

hangle: 수도의 대표적인 축제 중 하나인 꽃 축제랍니다.
first_translate: the flower festival is one of the most famous festivals held in the capital city.
haha...
yes...
normally, there wouldn’t have been enough time for me to finish going over all these ledgers,

hangle: 갑자기 꽃놀이를 오게 된 데는 이유가 있다.
first_translate: but there was a reason why I ended up coming out today.
lady fiona,

hangle: 지금 이 시기가 꽃놀이 하기에 제일 좋답니다.
first_translate: now would be the best time to go see the flowers.

hangle: 네? 저는 저택의 일을 해야 하는데요.
first_translate: pardon? but I still need to take care of things around the manor.
sometimes you must clear your head.

hangle: 전 항상 이맘때쯤 아가씨 또래의 손녀와 꽃놀이를 가곤 했어요.
first_translate: every year during this season, my granddaughter used to come visit me from her home far away just to look at the flowers together.

hangle: 이제는 같이 갈 수 없는데도, 자꾸 그때 생각이 나네요.
first_translate: and even though she can no longer do that now, I keep thinking about those times we spent together.

hangle: 피오나 아가씨는 바쁘셔서 대신 가주실 수도 없는데, 자꾸만…
first_translate: I know lady fiona has too much on her plate right now... however--
o-okay! I’ll go!!
let's go see some flowers!!!

hangle: 차마 안 가겠다고 할 수가 없어!
first_translate: how could I possibly say no after hearing him say something like that?!

hangle: -그렇게 해서, 잠깐 숨을 돌리러 나오게 된 것이다.
first_translate: that’s how I came to leave work behind for a little while.
celine told me only nobles use this park.
this place really isn’t as busy compared to where we were earlier.
of course not.
no way!
try using it yourself.
maybe next time.
it feels peaceful here.
unlike hailon.
when moments like this happen every once in a while,
I think about how unrealistic this world is.

hangle: 내가 만든 세계와 거기에 살고 있는 캐릭터.
first_translate: a world created by myself and characters living within it.
all events unfold according to what had already been predetermined.
does that make everything better?

hangle: 그렇다 해도 등장인물만 안 보이면 책 속 세계 같은 느낌이 덜해지긴 하지.
first_translate: still, if none of the main characters appear, then it doesn’t quite feel like I’ve entered into another world.
my role consisted of creating basic settings for the story,
setting up the male lead and female lead,

hangle: 그리고 그들의 주변 인물을 중심으로 일어나는 사건 정도니까.
first_translate: as well as writing side stories involving other minor characters surrounding them.

hangle: 많이 신경을 쓴 주조연급 캐릭터 수는…
first_translate: if I remember correctly, I put extra effort into developing roughly ten supporting character roles.
about ten or so.

hangle: 잠깐, 이 넓은 세계에서 고작 열 명?
first_translate: wait, only ten?! in such a vast universe?
that’s less than I thought...
oh no...!
I wasn’t paying attention and bumped into someone!

hangle: 평소 같으면 이런 실수는 절대 안 했을 텐데…
first_translate: I normally never get distracted like this...
oh dear,
are you alright?
y-yes...
no, please forgive me...
he looks like he’s somewhere in his early twenties.
not only does he wear elegant clothes,
but he also seems very polite.

hangle: 딱 봐도 높은 신분으로 보이는 모습.
first_translate: at first glance, he appears to be of high status.
on top of that,
he has deep red hair and golden eyes.
his features are stunningly handsome.
with such striking good looks...
in the end, this is a novel.
outstanding appearance = major character
that formula applies here!

hangle: 얼굴에 광이 나는 걸 보니 이 작자, 주연이 확실하다!
first_translate: judging by his face alone, I bet he plays a leading role!
but exactly who might he be?!
are you okay?
avoids eye contact
yes, I'm fine.
I apologize for bumping into you...
this tie pin...
it fell off because of me.
what is th--?
you don’t have to worry about it.
this isn’t simply any jewel...
it’s a mana stone.
mana stones.

hangle: 일반 사람이나 마력 운용이 불안정한 마법사들을 돕는 보조기구로서,
first_translate: they’re tools designed to help ordinary people or mages whose control over their powers aren’t stable yet.
according to the setting, they react when near magicians.

hangle: 난 마력 운용에 능숙한 편이라 마석을 사용해 본 적이 없었다.
first_translate: since I’m skilled at controlling my power, I’d never actually used a mana stone before.
given its reaction toward me,
then you must be a magician, miss.
I suppose calling myself a magician may be stretching it since I lack skill.
you seem rather humble.

hangle: 가볍게 손댄 것만으로 이 정도라면 평범한 실력이 아니실 터인데.
first_translate: for it to respond merely through light touch suggests you possess more talent than you let on.
furthermore, the color turned bright red...
come to think of it, I did set it up so that the stronger the magician,

hangle: 그 마법사가 강하다는 설정도 했었지 참…
first_translate: the clearer the change in color becomes...
so you truly hold exceptional abilities.
thank you...
well, then...
wait.
my name is...
arendt clovis.
right.
I remember who you are.
excuse me, but may I ask for your name?

hangle: …누군지 알게 된 이상, 내 이름을 알려줄 순 없겠어.
first_translate: now that he knows who I am, I can’t tell him mine.
i-it’s celine.
it was nice meeting you, ms. celine.
I hope our paths cross again someday.
me too...

hangle: 클로비스 후작님을 뵐 수 있어서 영광이었습니다.
first_translate: it was an honor to meet marquess clovis.
well, goodbye.
to think I forgot about him...
I must've lost my mind.
I guess I got caught up in sorting through the accounts.

hangle: 이전에 떠올린 재무부에 있는 유능한 인물이 바로 저놈이잖아!
first_translate: aren’t you the talented person working under the ministry of finance whom I previously recalled?!
arendt clovis.
keywords include “bad guy” and “schemer.”
he takes on the position of sub-male lead.
of course, whenever he’s in front of the heroine, eunice,
he acts extremely kind and courteous.
however,
none of that matters right now.

hangle: 현재 내가 빙의해버린 몸의 주인은 피오나.
first_translate: the body I currently inhabit belongs to fiona.
arendt...

hangle: 아렌트는 작중 피오나가 최종 보스에 이르게 된 결정적인 요인이었다.
first_translate: arendt played a crucial part in making fiona become the final boss of the story.
